Definition 7.2.4. In a metric space (sorry, sorry) : ?m.1 ?m.2(Unknown identifier `X`X, Unknown identifier `d`d), a subset Unknown identifier `V`sorry sorry : PropV Unknown identifier `X`X is open if for every Unknown identifier `x`sorry sorry : Propx Unknown identifier `V`V there exists Unknown identifier ``sorry > 0 : Prop > 0 such that the ball is contained in Unknown identifier `V`V. A subset Unknown identifier `E`sorry sorry : PropE Unknown identifier `X`X is closed if its complement Unknown identifier `X`sorry \ sorry : ?m.1X \ Unknown identifier `E`E is open. If Unknown identifier `x`sorry sorry : Propx Unknown identifier `V`V and Unknown identifier `V`V is open, then Unknown identifier `V`V is an open (or simply a) neighborhood of Unknown identifier `x`x.

def IsOpenMetric {X : Type*} [PseudoMetricSpace X] (V : Set X) : Prop := x V, > 0, Metric.ball x V

A set is closed in the metric sense if its complement is open.

def IsClosedMetric {X : Type*} [PseudoMetricSpace X] (E : Set X) : Prop := IsOpenMetric (E)

The book's notion of an open set agrees with the topological notion coming from the metric space structure.

theorem isOpenMetric_iff_isOpen {X : Type*} [PseudoMetricSpace X] (V : Set X) : IsOpenMetric V IsOpen V := by simpa [IsOpenMetric] using (Metric.isOpen_iff (s := V)).symm

The book's notion of a closed set agrees with IsClosed.{u} {X : Type u} [TopologicalSpace X] (s : Set X) : PropIsClosed.

theorem isClosedMetric_iff_isClosed {X : Type*} [PseudoMetricSpace X] (E : Set X) : IsClosedMetric E IsClosed E := by simpa [IsClosedMetric] using (isOpenMetric_iff_isOpen (V := E)).trans (isOpen_compl_iff (s := E))

An open set in the metric sense is a neighborhood of each of its points.

theorem isOpenMetric.mem_nhds {X : Type*} [PseudoMetricSpace X] {V : Set X} {x : X} (hV : IsOpenMetric V) (hx : x V) : V nhds x := by have hV' : IsOpen V := (isOpenMetric_iff_isOpen (V := V)).1 hV exact hV'.mem_nhds hx

lemma preimage_eq_iff_inter_image_subtype {X : Type*} {Y : Set X} (U : Set Y) (V : Set X) : Subtype.val ' V = U V Y = Subtype.val '' U := by constructor intro hpre ext x; constructor intro hx rcases hx with hxV, hxY refine x, hxY, ?_, rfl have hxpre : x, hxY Subtype.val ' V := by simpa using hxV simpa [hpre] using hxpre intro hx rcases hx with y, hy, rfl have hy' : y Subtype.val ' V := by simpa [hpre] using hy have hyV : y.val V := by simpa using hy' exact hyV, y.property intro hInter ext y; constructor intro hy have hy' : y.val V Y := hy, y.property have hy'' : y.val Subtype.val '' U := by simpa [hInter] using hy' rcases hy'' with u, hu, hval have : u = y := Subtype.ext hval simpa [this] using hu intro hy have hy' : y.val Subtype.val '' U := y, hy, rfl have hy'' : y.val V Y := by simpa [hInter] using hy' exact hy''.1lemma subspace_open_exists_open_superset {X : Type*} [PseudoMetricSpace X] {Y : Set X} {U : Set Y} : IsOpen U V : Set X, IsOpen V V Y = Subtype.val '' U := by intro hU rcases (isOpen_induced_iff : IsOpen U V : Set X, IsOpen V Subtype.val ' V = U).mp hU with V, hV, hpre exact V, hV, (preimage_eq_iff_inter_image_subtype (U := U) (V := V)).1 hprelemma exists_open_superset_subspace_open {X : Type*} [PseudoMetricSpace X] {Y : Set X} {U : Set Y} : ( V : Set X, IsOpen V V Y = Subtype.val '' U) IsOpen U := by rintro V, hV, hVU have hpre : Subtype.val ' V = U := (preimage_eq_iff_inter_image_subtype (U := U) (V := V)).2 hVU exact (isOpen_induced_iff : IsOpen U V : Set X, IsOpen V Subtype.val ' V = U).mpr V, hV, hprelemma image_preimage_subtype_eq {X : Type*} {V U : Set X} (hUV : U V) : Subtype.val '' (Subtype.val ' U : Set V) = U := by ext x; constructor rintro y, hy, rfl exact hy intro hxU exact x, hUV hxU, hxU, rfl

Proposition 7.2.11. For a metric space (sorry, sorry) : ?m.1 ?m.2(Unknown identifier `X`X, Unknown identifier `d`d) and subset Unknown identifier `Y`sorry sorry : PropY Unknown identifier `X`X, a subset Unknown identifier `U`sorry sorry : PropU Unknown identifier `Y`Y is open in the subspace topology if and only if there exists an open Unknown identifier `V`sorry sorry : PropV Unknown identifier `X`X with Unknown identifier `V`sorry sorry = sorry : PropV Unknown identifier `Y`Y = Unknown identifier `U`U.

lemma subspace_open_iff {X : Type*} [PseudoMetricSpace X] {Y : Set X} (U : Set Y) : IsOpen U V : Set X, IsOpen V V Y = Subtype.val '' U := by constructor exact subspace_open_exists_open_superset (U := U) exact exists_open_superset_subspace_open (U := U)

Proposition 7.2.12. In a metric space (sorry, sorry) : ?m.1 ?m.2(Unknown identifier `X`X, Unknown identifier `d`d), if Unknown identifier `V`sorry sorry : PropV Unknown identifier `X`X is open and Unknown identifier `E`sorry sorry : PropE Unknown identifier `X`X is closed, then: (i) a subset Unknown identifier `U`sorry sorry : PropU Unknown identifier `V`V is open in the subspace topology on Unknown identifier `V`V iff Unknown identifier `U`U is open in Unknown identifier `X`X; (ii) a subset Unknown identifier `F`sorry sorry : PropF Unknown identifier `E`E is closed in the subspace topology on Unknown identifier `E`E iff Unknown identifier `F`F is closed in Unknown identifier `X`X.

lemma open_in_open_subspace_iff {X : Type*} [PseudoMetricSpace X] {V U : Set X} (hV : IsOpen V) (hUV : U V) : IsOpen (Subtype.val ' U : Set V) IsOpen U := by constructor intro hUsub rcases (subspace_open_iff (U := (Subtype.val ' U : Set V))).1 hUsub with W, hWopen, hW have himage : Subtype.val '' (Subtype.val ' U : Set V) = U := image_preimage_subtype_eq (V := V) (U := U) hUV have hW' : W V = U := by simpa [himage] using hW have hopen : IsOpen (W V) := hWopen.inter hV simpa [hW'] using hopen intro hUopen refine (subspace_open_iff (U := (Subtype.val ' U : Set V))).2 ?_ have hUV' : U V = U := Set.inter_eq_left.mpr hUV have himage : Subtype.val '' (Subtype.val ' U : Set V) = U := image_preimage_subtype_eq (V := V) (U := U) hUV refine U, hUopen, ?_ simp [hUV', himage]
lemma closed_in_closed_subspace_iff {X : Type*} [PseudoMetricSpace X] {E F : Set X} (hE : IsClosed E) (hFE : F E) : IsClosed (Subtype.val ' F : Set E) IsClosed F := by constructor intro hFsub rcases (isClosed_induced_iff : IsClosed (Subtype.val ' F : Set E) C : Set X, IsClosed C Subtype.val ' C = (Subtype.val ' F : Set E)).mp hFsub with C, hCclosed, hpre have hCE : C E = Subtype.val '' (Subtype.val ' F : Set E) := (preimage_eq_iff_inter_image_subtype (U := (Subtype.val ' F : Set E)) (V := C)).1 hpre have hCE' : C E = F := by have himage : Subtype.val '' (Subtype.val ' F : Set E) = F := image_preimage_subtype_eq (V := E) (U := F) hFE simpa [himage] using hCE have hclosed_inter : IsClosed (C E) := hCclosed.inter hE simpa [hCE'] using hclosed_inter intro hF refine (isClosed_induced_iff : IsClosed (Subtype.val ' F : Set E) C : Set X, IsClosed C Subtype.val ' C = (Subtype.val ' F : Set E)).mpr ?_ exact F, hF, rfl

Definition 7.2.13. A nonempty metric space (sorry, sorry) : ?m.1 ?m.2(Unknown identifier `X`X, Unknown identifier `d`d) is connected if the only clopen subsets are : ?m.1 and the whole space. A nonempty space that is not connected is called disconnected. A nonempty subset Unknown identifier `A`sorry sorry : PropA Unknown identifier `X`X is connected when it is connected with the subspace topology.

def IsConnectedMetricSpace (X : Type*) [PseudoMetricSpace X] : Prop := Nonempty X V : Set X, IsOpen V IsClosed V V = ( : Set X) V = Set.univ

The book's notion of a connected metric space agrees with ConnectedSpace.{u} ( : Type u) [TopologicalSpace ] : PropConnectedSpace.

theorem isConnectedMetricSpace_iff_connectedSpace (X : Type*) [PseudoMetricSpace X] : IsConnectedMetricSpace X ConnectedSpace X := by constructor intro h rcases h with hne, hclopen refine (connectedSpace_iff_clopen).2 ?_ refine hne, ?_ intro s hs exact hclopen s hs.2 hs.1 intro h rcases (connectedSpace_iff_clopen).1 h with hne, hclopen refine hne, ?_ intro s hsopen hsclosed exact hclopen s hsclosed, hsopen

A subset is connected in the book's sense when it is connected with the subspace topology.

def IsConnectedSubset {X : Type*} [PseudoMetricSpace X] (A : Set X) : Prop := IsConnected A

Proposition 7.2.14. A nonempty subset Unknown identifier `S`S of a metric space is disconnected iff there are open sets Unknown identifier `U`U and Unknown identifier `U`U in the ambient space such that Unknown identifier `U`sorry sorry sorry = : PropU Unknown identifier `U`U Unknown identifier `S`S = , both intersections Unknown identifier `U`sorry sorry : ?m.1U Unknown identifier `S`S and Unknown identifier `U`sorry sorry : ?m.1U Unknown identifier `S`S are nonempty, and Unknown identifier `S`sorry = sorry sorry sorry sorry : PropS = (Unknown identifier `U`U Unknown identifier `S`S) (Unknown identifier `U`U Unknown identifier `S`S).

Proposition 7.2.16. A nonempty subset of : Type is connected if and only if it is an interval or a single point.

Definition 7.2.18. In a metric space (sorry, sorry) : ?m.1 ?m.2(Unknown identifier `X`X, Unknown identifier `d`d) and for Unknown identifier `A`sorry sorry : PropA Unknown identifier `X`X, the closure is the intersection of all closed sets containing Unknown identifier `A`A.

def closureByClosed {X : Type*} [PseudoMetricSpace X] (A : Set X) : Set X := {E : Set X | IsClosed E A E}

The closure defined as the intersection of closed supersets agrees with the topological closure.

theorem closureByClosed_eq_closure {X : Type*} [PseudoMetricSpace X] (A : Set X) : closureByClosed A = closure A := by rfl

Proposition 7.2.22. Definition 7.2.23. In a metric space (sorry, sorry) : ?m.1 ?m.2(Unknown identifier `X`X, Unknown identifier `d`d) and a subset Unknown identifier `A`sorry sorry : PropA Unknown identifier `X`X, the interior of Unknown identifier `A`A is the set of points Unknown identifier `x`sorry sorry : Propx Unknown identifier `A`A for which there exists Unknown identifier ``sorry > 0 : Prop > 0 with . The boundary of Unknown identifier `A`A is .

def metricInterior {X : Type*} [PseudoMetricSpace X] (A : Set X) : Set X := {x | x A > 0, Metric.ball x A}

The metric description of the interior agrees with the topological interior coming from the metric space structure.

theorem metricInterior_eq_interior {X : Type*} [PseudoMetricSpace X] (A : Set X) : metricInterior A = interior A := by ext x; constructor intro hx rcases hx with hxA, , h, hball refine (mem_interior).2 ?_ refine Metric.ball x , hball, Metric.isOpen_ball, ?_ exact Metric.mem_ball_self h intro hx rcases (mem_interior).1 hx with t, htA, htopen, hxt rcases (Metric.isOpen_iff).1 htopen x hxt with , h, hball refine htA hxt, , h, ?_ intro y hy exact htA (hball hy)

The boundary of a subset is its closure minus its interior.

def metricBoundary {X : Type*} [PseudoMetricSpace X] (A : Set X) : Set X := closure A \ metricInterior A

The boundary defined via closure and interior agrees with the topological frontier.

theorem metricBoundary_eq_frontier {X : Type*} [PseudoMetricSpace X] (A : Set X) : metricBoundary A = frontier A := by calc metricBoundary A = closure A \ metricInterior A := rfl _ = closure A \ interior A := by rw [metricInterior_eq_interior] _ = frontier A := rfl

Proposition 7.2.26. In a metric space, the interior of any subset is open and the boundary is closed.

lemma interior_open_boundary_closed {X : Type*} [PseudoMetricSpace X] (A : Set X) : IsOpen (interior A) IsClosed (frontier A) := by constructor exact isOpen_interior exact isClosed_frontier
lemma not_mem_interior_iff_ball_meets_compl {X : Type*} [PseudoMetricSpace X] {A : Set X} {x : X} : x interior A > 0, (Metric.ball x A).Nonempty := by classical constructor intro hx h by_contra hEmpty have hsubset : Metric.ball x A := by intro y hy by_contra hyA exact hEmpty y, hy, hyA have hx_ball : x Metric.ball x := by have : dist x x < := by simpa using h simpa [Metric.ball] using this have hball_open : IsOpen (Metric.ball x ) := Metric.isOpen_ball have hball_interior : Metric.ball x interior A := interior_maximal hsubset hball_open exact hx (hball_interior hx_ball) intro h hxint rcases (Metric.isOpen_iff.mp isOpen_interior) x hxint with , h, hsubset have hsubsetA : Metric.ball x A := Set.Subset.trans hsubset interior_subset rcases h h with y, hyBall, hyCompl exact hyCompl (hsubsetA hyBall)

Proposition 7.2.26. For a subset Unknown identifier `A`A of a metric space, the interior is open and the boundary is closed.

lemma metricInterior_open_metricBoundary_closed {X : Type*} [PseudoMetricSpace X] (A : Set X) : IsOpen (metricInterior A) IsClosed (metricBoundary A) := by constructor rw [metricInterior_eq_interior] exact (interior_open_boundary_closed (X := X) (A := A)).1 rw [metricBoundary_eq_frontier] exact (interior_open_boundary_closed (X := X) (A := A)).2

Proposition 7.2.27. A point Unknown identifier `x`x lies in the boundary of a subset Unknown identifier `A`A of a metric space if and only if every open ball around Unknown identifier `x`x meets both Unknown identifier `A`A and its complement.

lemma mem_frontier_iff_ball_intersects {X : Type*} [PseudoMetricSpace X] {A : Set X} {x : X} : x frontier A > 0, (Metric.ball x A).Nonempty (Metric.ball x A).Nonempty := by classical constructor intro hx change x closure A \ interior A at hx rcases hx with hxClosure, hxNotInterior intro h constructor exact (mem_closure_iff_ball_intersects).1 hxClosure h exact (not_mem_interior_iff_ball_meets_compl).1 hxNotInterior h intro h have hA : > 0, (Metric.ball x A).Nonempty := fun h => (h h).1 have hAcompl : > 0, (Metric.ball x A).Nonempty := fun h => (h h).2 have hxClosure : x closure A := (mem_closure_iff_ball_intersects).2 hA have hxNotInterior : x interior A := (not_mem_interior_iff_ball_meets_compl).2 hAcompl exact by change x closure A \ interior A exact hxClosure, hxNotInterior

Corollary 7.2.28. For a subset Unknown identifier `A`A of a metric space, the boundary is the intersection of the closures of Unknown identifier `A`A and its complement: .

lemma frontier_eq_closure_inter_closure_compl {X : Type*} [PseudoMetricSpace X] (A : Set X) : frontier A = closure A closure (A) := by simpa using (frontier_eq_closure_inter_closure (s := A))
